OOC: You underestimate the inevitable pain threshold of someone who's 
alternately been a punching bag, target practice, and occasionally a 
sex toy for nine years.  Phoenix has to be taking a huge whale of a 
beating before she actually screams in pain.  A branding torch 
doesn't cut it - no pun intended.

Phoenix::

The femme doesn't give them the statisfaction of hearing her scream 
during the branding, although several pained grunts escape her 
gritted teeth.  Phoenix knows how to deal with pain, and she focuses 
on anything but the burning of her own body to bear the torment in 
relative silence.

Heartbreak's treatment is another matter.  As she lands hard on her 
back, memories surface of the things Clawful did to her, and Phoenix 
scrambles away, standing up and backing into a corner.  Trembling, 
the femme tries to calm herself - there's no way it could be as bad 
as before, she rationalizes, since HBK doesn't have claws he could 
spear her to the floor with for starters.  It doesn't work - her mind 
keeps superimposing the image of the Rogue berserker over Heartbreak.

Fear grips her spark compartment with an icy hand.  Seemingly in 
response to the threat, she feels her unstable mutant spark flare up 
and send hot tendrils of energy throughout her body.  Even more 
terrified of her own poorly understood powers than of anything the 
nWo might do to her, she tries to suppress the reaction to no avail.

The first external indication that something has gone very wrong is 
when Phoenix drops to her knees, her arms wrapped around her chest 
like she's trying to keep herself from exploding, and that's not far 
from the truth.  Strange energy patterns begin sparking across her 
frame.  (Think when the BW characters get energon deep-fried, only 
the lightning is orange instead of blue.)

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Hollywood Narrator" 
<hollywood.narrator@v...> wrote:
> OOC: The sound of Hollywood Narrator typing a post woke up the 
neighborhood. People called the cops.
> 
> BIC:
> 
> Arrow had watched the events with indifference. He had certain laws 
he abided by. His own twisted laws. One of those was not to question 
what his fellow bot did. And he hadn't done so, yet. Back in his days 
with the Radicons, when he had received the lobotomy from the leader 
of the group, Kracken, he still never questioned any orders or 
actions. When a comrade made a mistake, he would let it play out, and 
when an enemy made a mistake, he would take quick action and harm 
them quickly and efficiently. Sneaky kills were obviously not against 
his law, as he recalls right at the moment how he had ripped the 
spark from the body of the very child he had cared for in the 
Chivtrons. He considered it a merciful act.
> 
> Deemos, meanwhile, was quite shocked by the events. He thought it 
was disgusting and inappropriate. This was hypocrisy, as Deemos was 
the one who had sliced a team member to bits just for not doing 
better in battle when Deemos led his own group. He briefly recalls 
Shokaract co-leading his group and almost becomes glad, for some 
unknown reason, but then puts his attention back on the events at 
hand. His optics lit up brightly when Heartbreak had kissed Phoenix 
and thrown her down. He knew the previous events would be 
commonplace, but he thought this was going too far. However, this 
thought came from the guy who had plotted viciously killing his wife 
and son and had succeeded.
> 
> Spider, meanwhile, had the third point of view. He was proud and 
smiling. He enjoyed everything that went on. He was a rookie bot who 
was eager for action and any sort of exciting event, no matter what 
kind.
> 
> Meanwhile, a couple of STASIS PODS (I'm sick of ships) fall down on 
the planet. What will they become? What sides will they be on? Does 
anyone care?...
> 
>   ----- Original Message -----
>   From: Richard Allen
>   To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com
>   Sent: Sunday, February 16, 2003 5:09 PM
>   Subject: Party at nWo base!
> 
> 
>   : : Wolfenstein/Razor/Diesel/Heartbreak : :
> 
>   Wolfenstein gets out of the CR chamber. He had been changed to 
white and black and now sported the nWo logo. He headed back to the 
cell block.
> 
>   Diesel had grown impatient with Hollywood, and got the branding 
torch himself. He handed it to Razor.
> 
>   HBK let the forcefield to the cell down and all nWo members 
steped in for the party.
> 
>   Heartbreak and Diesel took hold of Phoenix's arms from behind, 
holding her in place.
> 
>   Razor activated the torch, with a evil grin on his face. He 
stepped forward very slowly, surely scaring the femme bot.
> 
>   Razor: Now my dear, you will belong to us. If you... service us 
you may live. If you refuse, I'll kill you where you stand.
> 
>   Razor reached out with the torch and began to ingrave letters 
into the beautiful body of Phoenix. She would surely be screaming 
from the pain, as the energon flame burnt through her armor, melting 
pieces of her away. As Razor finished, Phoenix had the nWo logo 
burned across her chest. She had been branded.
> 
>   All the boys started to laugh at what they had done. All except 
Wolfenstein, who looked away. There were almost tears in his eyes. 
This wasn't right, she didn't deserve this. The physical damage could 
be repaired but mentaly? Could anyone recover from an event like this?
> 
>   No time had passed from the branding before Heartbreak took 
action. He grabbed Phoenix bringing the hot femme to him, roughly. He 
was grabbing hard, probably hurting her. He kissed her unwilling 
form, before throwing her down with great force.
> 
>   Heartbreak: I'm going to like this!
> 
>   The preceding has been paid for by the
> 
>   New World Order
